actions.committee: Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs with amendment, S. Rept. 93-592.
Referred to House Committee on House Administration.

official_title: A bill to provide for the addition of the names of the States of Alaska and Hawaii to the list of the forty-eight States inscribed upon the walls of the Lincoln National Memorial.

summary.text: (LATEST SUMMARY) Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to inscribe the names of Alaska and Hawaii on the walls of the Lincoln Memorial with the names of the other forty-eight states in a manner and style consistent with the other states. Makes the authorization of the Secretary contingent on approval of the design and plans for the inscription by the National Capital Planning Commission, the Commission of Fine Arts, and by the Advisory Council on Historic Preservation. Authorizes an appropriation, not to exceed $12,000, to cover the cost of design development and implementation.

titles.title: A bill to provide for the addition of the names of the States of Alaska and Hawaii to the list of the forty-eight States inscribed upon the walls of the Lincoln National Memorial.
